    • Field Detail

      • aclSpec

        private final List<org.apache.hadoop.fs.permission.AclEntry> aclSpec

    • Constructor Detail

      • AclTransformation.ValidatedAclSpec

        public AclTransformation.ValidatedAclSpec(List<org.apache.hadoop.fs.permission.AclEntry> aclSpec)
                                   throws AclException
        Creates a ValidatedAclSpec by pre-validating and sorting the given ACL entries. Pre-validation checks that it does not exceed the maximum entries. This check is performed before modifying the ACL, and it's actually insufficient for enforcing the maximum number of entries. Transformation logic can create additional entries automatically,such as the mask and some of the default entries, so we also need additional checks during transformation. The up-front check is still valuable here so that we don't run a lot of expensive transformation logic while holding the namesystem lock for an attacker who intentionally sent a huge ACL spec.
        Parameters:
        aclSpec - List containing unvalidated input ACL spec
        Throws:
        AclException - if validation fails

    • Method Detail

      • containsKey

        public boolean containsKey(org.apache.hadoop.fs.permission.AclEntry key)
        Returns true if this contains an entry matching the given key. An ACL entry's key consists of scope, type and name (but not permission).
        Parameters:
        key - AclEntry search key
        Returns:
        boolean true if found

      • findByKey

        public org.apache.hadoop.fs.permission.AclEntry findByKey(org.apache.hadoop.fs.permission.AclEntry key)
        Returns the entry matching the given key or null if not found. An ACL entry's key consists of scope, type and name (but not permission).
        Parameters:
        key - AclEntry search key
        Returns:
        AclEntry entry matching the given key or null if not found
